security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only static Tailwind CSS reference patterns. No code execution, network access, or file system operations. Contains only HTML/CSS code snippets for responsive design, components, and utility classes.

content.value_statement: Finding the right Tailwind utility classes slows down development. This skill provides quick access to responsive breakpoints, common layout patterns, component snippets, and dark mode patterns for Tailwind CSS v3+ projects.
actual_capabilities: Provides responsive breakpoint references (sm, md, lg, xl, 2xl)
Shares common layout patterns (centered containers, flexbox, grid, stacks)
Delivers component snippets (buttons, cards, forms, navigation)
Explains state modifiers (hover, focus, active, group-hover)
Includes spacing scale reference (p-1 through p-8)
Covers dark mode implementation with class-based toggling
limitations: Does not generate custom Tailwind configurations
Does not validate existing Tailwind classes
Does not integrate with build tools or processors
Only provides patterns for Tailwind CSS v3 and newer

output_examples.input: Show me a Tailwind CSS button with hover effect
output: Button with hover effect: bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 transition-colors
Key classes: bg-blue-600 (background), text-white (text color), px-4 py-2 (padding), rounded-lg (border radius), hover:bg-blue-700 (hover state), transition-colors (smooth transition)

best_practices: Use responsive prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:) to adapt layouts for different screen sizes
Combine utility classes for complex components instead of writing custom CSS
Use the spacing scale consistently (p-4, m-6, gap-8) for visual harmony
anti_patterns: Avoid magic numbers in arbitrary values when standard scale values exist
Do not hardcode colors instead of using the Tailwind color palette
Avoid deeply nested div structures when flexbox or grid can simplify layout

faq.question: Which Tailwind versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers Tailwind CSS v3 and newer versions. Features like arbitrary values and dark mode with class strategy work with v3+.

faq.question: What responsive breakpoints are available?
faq.answer: Tailwind uses sm: 640px, md: 768px, lg: 1024px, xl: 1280px, and 2xl: 1536px. Mobile-first approach applies by default.

faq.question: Can I use this with React, Vue, or other frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns are framework-agnostic HTML/CSS snippets that work with any framework using Tailwind CSS.

faq.question: Does this skill write to my project files?
faq.answer: No. This is a read-only reference skill. It provides patterns for you to copy into your codebase manually.

faq.question: Why are my Tailwind classes not working?
faq.answer: Ensure your tailwind.config.js is set up correctly, your content paths include your files, and you have built your project after adding new classes.

faq.question: How is this different from Tailwind documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides quick copy-paste patterns for common use cases. The official docs are comprehensive reference material for all available utilities.
